titlestmt.titleproper: A Finding Aid to the Mount Rushmore monument photographic transparencies, circa 1938-1939, in the Archives of American Art
titlestmt.author: Judy Ng

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-02-18 19:43:50 -0500.

did.abstract: The Mount Rushmore monument photographic transparencies measure 0.04 linear feet and date from circa 1938 to 1939. The color transparencies depict the construction of the presidential portraits atop Mount Rushmore. Several show the sculptor, Gutzon Borglum, and others at work on the project.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The photographic transparencies were donated in 1988 by collector Michael De Vivo, who received the materials from the J. Walter Thompson advertising agency in New York.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: The collection was digitized in its entirety in 2016 and is available on the Archives of American Art's website.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The collection was described and prepared for digitization by Judy Ng in 2016.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Mount Rushmore monument photographic transparencies, circa 1938-1939. Archives of American Art, Smithsonian Institution.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Use of original papers requires an appointment and is limited to the Archives' Washington, D.C. Research Center. Contact Reference Services for more information.

userestrict.head: Terms of Use
userestrict.p: The Archives of American Art makes its archival collections available for non-commercial, educational and personal use unless restricted by copyright and/or donor restrictions, including but not limited to access and publication restrictions. AAA makes no representations concerning such rights and restrictions and it is the user's responsibility to determine whether rights or restrictions exist and to obtain any necessary permission to access, use, reproduce and publish the collections. Please refer to the Smithsonian's Terms of Use for additional information.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Michael De Vivo is a collector from Bedford Hills, New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Mount Rushmore monument photographic transparencies measure 0.4 linear feet and date from circa 1938 to 1939. The color transparencies depict the construction of the presidential portraits atop Mount Rushmore. Several show the sculptor, Gutzon Borglum, and others at work on the project.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged as 1 series.

list.item: Series 1: Photographic Materials, circa 1938-1939 (0.1 linear feet; Box 1)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Ektachrome color transparencies depict the construction of the presidential portraits atop Mount Rushmore. Several show the sculptor, Gutzon Borglum, and others at work on busts of Abraham Lincoln and Theodore Roosevelt.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: This series has been scanned in its entirety.

did.unittitle: Gutzon Borglum and Others at Work on Mount Rushmore

dao.ns2:title: Gutzon Borglum and Others at Work on Mount Rushmore

daodesc.p: Gutzon Borglum and Others at Work on Mount Rushmore: circa 1938-1939

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Images depict the construction of Abraham Lincoln and Theodore Roosevelt, as well as panoramic shots of Mount Rushmore.
